about_the_game:
Star Spectre is a single player space combat game with tons of exploration and numerous RPG elements.
You will be free to explore and trade, as well as fight in a vast galaxy.


“Little is known of what led to the destruction of the Earth, save that a terrible war swept the face of the planet and reduced the entire landscape to ashes and rubble. Billions perished, and the survivors found themselves desolate. The only structures to survive were the great space stations located off-world. Over time, over the years, search parties were sent down to gather up the remainder of humanity. Engines were built, and one by one, starship after starship left for uncharted space.
When the fledgling colony ships came again into habitable space, the innumerable colonists were more than ready to settle down. Planets were settled, terraforming operations began, and civilization exploded. Cultures were formed, some grown from memories of Old Earth, and some created fresh for the new galaxy. It was a time of peace, a time of exploration, a time of wonder, and a time of joy.
Once more, time passed. Soon enough, the galaxy began to fill up. Rival cultures that had once been able simply to avoid one another began to bump shoulders once again. Conflict came again to the galaxy… And like Old Earth before it, no one knew quite how to handle the upcoming war.”
You will play as a “Freelancer” in a post-colonial era space. As the game progresses,
you will gradually learn about what is happening within and between the numerous factions.



Fast and furious battles play a main role in Star Spectre, which can let you experience the large-scale interstellar combat you ever dream about.
Combat takes up a large proportion of the whole game, the smooth combat process, the choice of various fighters and the different scenery of each galaxy make the whole game fun to fight.


Star Spectre offers you a huge variety of space fighters.
Each faction has its unique fighters, which you can make your choice base on your personal preferences.
And with different weapons and equipment, you can play through the game with your personal style.


The game has a perfect trading system with hundreds of goods.
Travel as many locations as you can through the universe and try to be a slick space trader.
The principle of trade is as simple as you can imagine, buy low and sell high.
Each space station has different kinds of goods and different prices, and if you have been to enough places, the price differences among places will at a glance.
Trading between different factions is the most profitable way. But of course, it also means you're taking greater risks.



You are free to choose between the various factions. You can either choose to help the four major galactic governments to fight the crime, or you can also be the crime itself. Of course, you can also be uncontested, maintain neutrality and focus on trade.
During the game you will receive quests from one of those factions, after completing them, you will increase your relationship with that faction. However, you need a neutral position to keep receiving quests, and you can always look for a hacker to modify your evaluation record. Of course, this will cause you a certain amount of money.
Many of those factions are connected to each other, if you have a friendly relationship with a faction's alliance factions, the relationship with this faction will also improve, and vice versa.
Therefore, it is impossible to keep all factions stay friendly to you.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: Windows 7 / 8.1 / 10 / 11 (64-bit OS required)
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-2500K
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia GeForce GTX 780
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 45 GB available space

  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia GeForce GTX 1060 (6 GB) or AMD Radeon RX 580 (8GB)
